DOC.brief_summary: After undergo laparoscopic appendectomy , child may experience degree pain postoperative period . As routine part procedure , surgeon inject local anesthetic laparoscopic port place . This provide pain relief , child still require additional pain medication surgery . The purpose study see combination peripheral nerve block ( rectus sheath ilioinguinal nerve ) give good pain relief , decrease pain medication requirement increase comfort postoperative period .
DOC.brief_title: Postoperative Pain Control Children Undergoing Laparoscopic Appendectomy : Peripheral Nerve Block Versus Local Anesthetic
DOC.detailed_description: A study investigator involve immediate care patient use computer generate randomized table whether child undergo laparoscopic appendectomy receive local anesthetic infiltration laparoscopic port placement sit surgeon , peripheral nerve block anesthesiologist . All subject receive dose fentanyl 2 mcg/kg maximum dose 100 mcg . If subject get peripheral nerve block , anesthesiologist administer bilateral rectus sheath ilioinguinal nerve block ultrasound guidance induction general anesthesia . The local anesthetic use 0.25 % bupivacaine without epinephrine local infiltration peripheral nerve block . It show dose 0.075 ml/kg minimum amount local anesthetic need successful block . This dose block maximum 3 ml rectus sheath block , 4 ml ilioinguinal block add total maximum dose 14 ml 0.25 % bupivacaine . The infiltration port site surgeon also limit total 14 ml . If subject adequate analgesia post anesthesia care unit ( PACU ) , may receive morphine 0.05 mg/kg ( max 2 mg ) per dose ; may receive dose ketorolac 0.5 mg/kg ( max 30 mg ) per surgeon preference . A blinded observer observe subject pain PACU use validated pain scale , Faces Pain Scale - Revised ( FPS-R ) . The need additional pain medication note observer PACU follow first 24 hour postoperatively .
